<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 155, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 90]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 183]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 331]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 495, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 465]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 488, 336, 505]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 509, 428, 580]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 721]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 791, 594, 880]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C\] \[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 101, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 767, 94]]<|/det|>
Write \(19 - 12x - 3x^{2}\) in the form \(a(x + b)^{2} + c\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 370, 144, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 370, 920, 406]]<|/det|>
Hence find the maximum value of \(19 - 12x - 3x^{2}\) and the value of \(x\) at which this maximum occurs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 386, 920, 405]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 524, 144, 543]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 523, 720, 543]]<|/det|>
Use your answer to part (a) to solve the equation \(19 - 12\sqrt{u} - 3u = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 543]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 465, 89]]<|/det|>
Solve the following simultaneous equations.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 100, 556, 119]]<|/det|>
\[5x - 3\ln y = 2\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 120, 556, 139]]<|/det|>
\[x + \ln y = 1\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 82, 96, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 77, 379, 108]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \biggl (4x + 5 - \frac{1}{2x + 3}\biggr)\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 146, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 789, 467]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{1}^{3}\biggl (4x + 5 - \frac{1}{2x + 3}\biggr)\mathrm{d}x,\) simplifying your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 438, 920, 457]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 403, 89]]<|/det|>
In this question \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Three terms in the expansion of \(\left(2 + a x\right)^{5}(1 + b x)\) are \(32 + 112x - 240x^{2}\) . Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 413, 89]]<|/det|>
In this question \(p\) and \(q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 112, 863, 144]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = \frac{p}{x^2} + 5x - 2\), at the point where \(x = 1\), has equation \(y = -x + q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 148, 328, 168]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 868, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the constant \(a\) for which the line \(y = (2a + 1)x - 10\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = ax^{2} - 5x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 69, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A particle moves in a straight line. At time \(t\) seconds after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its velocity, \(v \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\), is given by \(v = 10 \sin 2t - 6 \cos 2t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 120, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 120, 579, 139]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for the acceleration of the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 243, 146, 262]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 241, 425, 262]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration when \(t = \frac{\pi}{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 244, 920, 263]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 352, 144, 370]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 351, 559, 371]]<|/det|>
Find the first time at which the acceleration is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 352, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 570, 146, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 567, 655, 591]]<|/det|>
Find the displacement of the particle between \(t = \frac{\pi}{4}\) and \(t = \frac{\pi}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 570, 920, 588]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 586, 91]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \((2 - \sqrt{10})x^{2} + x + (2 + \sqrt{10}) = 0\), giving your answers in the form \(a + b\sqrt{10}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are rational. [7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 71, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 648, 89]]<|/det|>
The functions f and g are defined as follows, for all real values of \(x\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 100, 559, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = 2x^{2} - 1\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 122, 549, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = \mathrm{e}^{x} + 1\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 157, 146, 175]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 157, 390, 175]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{fg}(x) = 8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 157, 920, 175]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 514, 146, 532]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 514, 920, 547]]<|/det|>
For each of the functions f and g, either explain why the inverse function does not exist or find the inverse function, stating its domain.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 472, 89]]<|/det|>
In this question all lengths are in centimetres.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 97, 675, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 920, 326]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle centre \(O\) with radius 6. The line \(AB\) is a tangent to the circle at the point \(B\). The point \(C\) lies on the circle such that \(AOC\) is a straight line. \(AB = 8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 338, 146, 356]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 338, 470, 356]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 338, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 428, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 104, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 79, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 76, 240, 100]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 72, 598, 106]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{\sec x - \cosec x} +\frac{1}{\sec x + \cosec x} = \frac{2\cos x}{1 - \cot^2 x}.\]
